links.title: UPDATE 2-TSMC forecasts Q2 sales surge on strong chip demand
links.description: Taiwan's TSMC posted a better-than-expected surge in quarterly profit on Thursday and forecast an up to 37% jump in current-quarter sales, as a global chip crunch has kept order books full and allowed chipmakers to charge premium prices.

message.body:
HERE'S A SUMMARY OF TSMC'S MASSIVE EARNINGS BEAT AND STRONG GUIDANCE, SHARE THIS EVERYWHERE AND SQUEEZE THE SHORTS!  
 
$TSM EARNINGS: 
- Revenue: $17.57B vs. $16.97B Expected 
- EPS: $1.40 vs. $1.30 Expected 
- Revenue growth of 36% YoY and 12% QoQ 
- HPC and Automotive driving QoQ growth 
 
 
GUIDANCE BY TSMC CEO C.C. Wei 
- TSMC sees another strong year for semiconductors. "We continue to observe the structural increase in semiconductor demand." 
- Expect 2022 revenue to meet or exceed guidance of high-20s % growth in US dollar terms.  
- Guides on its call for Q2 revenue of $17.6B-$18.2B. Compares with Q1 revenue of $17.57B. HPC/auto growth said to offset smartphone seasonality. 
- Full-year capex guidance of $40B-$44B is reiterated. 
 
$TSM $AMD $NVDA $SMH $AAPL
